executive_summary.threat_overview: Critical vulnerability chain in Ivanti Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM) enabling unauthenticated remote code execution through authentication bypass followed by code injection. Active exploitation observed by China-nexus espionage groups with custom malware deployment.
executive_summary.business_impact: CRITICAL - Direct threat to Authentication Systems, Customer Database, and Remote Access Systems. High probability of data exfiltration, credential harvesting, and persistent access establishment.
executive_summary.immediacy: Immediate action required - Patches available since May 13, 2025, but active exploitation ongoing with multiple threat actor groups deploying custom malware.
executive_summary.crown_jewel_risk: Severe impact to 3 of 5 defined crown jewels with potential for lateral movement to Email Systems and Payment Processing.

components.description: Pre-authentication bypass enabling unauthenticated API access
Expression Language injection for arbitrary Java code execution

vulnerability_chain.exploitation_flow: Attacker accesses unprotected /rs/api/v2/featureusage endpoint (CVE-2025-4427) → Crafts malicious format parameter with EL injection (CVE-2025-4428) → Achieves unauthenticated RCE → Deploys custom malware

primary_actors.targeting: PII, authentication credentials, lateral movement data
primary_actors.infrastructure: Amazon AWS S3 buckets for payload delivery

CVE-2025-4427.admiralty_rating: A1 (Completely reliable source, Confirmed by other sources)
CVE-2025-4427.technical_mechanism: Missing Spring Security intercept-url configuration rules for /rs/api/v2/featureusage endpoint allows unauthenticated access to protected resources
exploitation_indicators: Suspicious user agents in EPMM logs

CVE-2025-4428.admiralty_rating: A1 (Completely reliable source, Confirmed by other sources)
CVE-2025-4428.technical_mechanism: Expression Language injection in DeviceFeatureUsageReportQueryRequestValidator via format parameter processed by Spring AbstractMessageSource enables Runtime.exec() calls
exploitation_indicators: Malformed format parameters in API requests
Unexpected process spawning from EPMM service
EL injection patterns in HTTP requests

risk_factors: Direct compromise of EPMM authentication mechanisms
affected_assets.business_consequences: Complete authentication system compromise enabling unauthorized access to all protected resources

risk_factors: Direct access to PII through compromised EPMM system
affected_assets.business_consequences: Large-scale customer data breach with regulatory, financial, and reputational impacts

risk_factors: EPMM serves as gateway for mobile device management
Compromise enables lateral movement to managed devices
VPN and remote access credential exposure
Mobile device enrollment and management compromise
affected_assets.business_consequences: Complete remote access infrastructure compromise affecting all mobile workforce

secondary_risks.risk_pathway: Lateral movement from compromised EPMM to email infrastructure using harvested credentials
Access to payment systems through compromised mobile applications managed by EPMM

exploitability.justification: Unauthenticated RCE with public PoC code and active ITW exploitation

impact.justification: Critical system compromise affecting core authentication and data systems

exposure.justification: EPMM systems typically internet-facing for mobile device management

mitigation_difficulty.justification: Patches available but require system upgrades and potential downtime

threat_actor_correlation.attribution_confidence: High for China-nexus groups, Medium for other actors

campaign_analysis.targeting_pattern: Global, focus on technology and government sectors

related_campaigns: Supply chain attacks through endpoint management systems

immediate_actions.action: Emergency patching of all Ivanti EPMM systems
immediate_actions.details: Upgrade to EPMM version 12.5.0.1 or later immediately. Patches released May 13, 2025.
Restrict network access to EPMM systems to essential traffic only until patching complete
Activate incident response procedures, preserve logs, begin forensic analysis

short_term_actions.details: Scan for indicators of compromise, webshells, and malware presence
Rotate all authentication credentials potentially accessible through EPMM compromise
Deploy additional monitoring for EPMM systems and related infrastructure

long_term_actions.details: Review EPMM deployment architecture, implement defense-in-depth controls
Assess all managed mobile devices for potential compromise indicators

network_indicators: HTTP requests with malformed format parameters
Unexpected outbound connections from EPMM systems
Connections to known malicious AWS S3 buckets
system_indicators: Unexpected Java processes spawned by EPMM service
Webshell artifacts in EPMM directory structure
New user accounts or privilege escalations

detection_rules: Alert on EL injection patterns in HTTP parameters
Detect Runtime.exec() calls from EPMM processes
